document_title: Benign paroxysmal vertigo: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: chong-mat-kich-phat-lanh-tinh.json_3_Who is at risk for benign paroxysmal vertigo?
subsection_content:
Anyone can experience benign paroxysmal positional vertigo. However, the disease often appears in people over 50 years old. Young people are less likely to experience benign paroxysmal vertigo.
Besides, gender is also a risk factor in people with benign paroxysmal vertigo. Accordingly, men will be more susceptible to the disease than women.
And the final factor that increases the likelihood of benign paroxysmal vertigo is head trauma or disorders related to the vestibular system in the inner ear.
